abstract: Britain's parliament clears former foreign ministers Malcolm Rifkind and Jack Straw on charges that they solicited consultancy work for Chinese firm; parliamentary standards commissioner rules code of conduct permits such arrangements if disclosed, and criticizes journalists who recorded transaction and presented bogus company to lawmakers.
lead_paragraph: Undercover reporters had recorded Malcolm Rifkind and Jack Straw, both then members of Parliament, offering to do paid consultancy work for a fictional Chinese company.

headline.main: Two Former British Foreign Ministers Are Cleared in Parliamentary Ethics Inquiry
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Europe; Britain: Ex-Foreign Ministers Cleared of Wrongdoing

snippet: Undercover reporters had recorded Malcolm Rifkind and Jack Straw, both then members of Parliament, offering to do paid consultancy work for a fictional Chinese company.
